authors.bio: Friendly tech educator, family man, diversity champion, probably argue a bit too much. Formerly a backend engineer. Talk to me about JavaScript (frontend or backend), the amazing Vue.js, DevOps, DevSecOps, anything JamStack. Writer on DEV.to
authors.name: Luke Oliff
authors.title: Vonage Developer Educator

authors.bio: Greg is a Developer Educator @Vonage. Coming from a PHP background, but not restricted to one language. An avid gamer and a Raspberry pi enthusiast. Often found bouldering at indoor climbing venues.
authors.name: Greg Holmes
Lorna Mitchell
authors.bio: Lorna is a software engineer with an incurable blogging habit. She works on the Developer Relations team at Nexmo and tries to tame words and code in equal measure.

authors.name: Nahrin Jalal
authors.bio: Nahrin is a Developer Educator for Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform. She is passionate about building inclusive communities, pragmatic software solutions, and creating technical content that is accessible to all skill levels.
authors.title: Developer Educator

authors.name: Martyn Davies
authors.bio: Head of Developer Education at Vonage. With a background as a creative developer, product manager, and hack day organizer, Martyn has been working as a technology advocate since 2012 having previously spent time in broadcasting and major record companies. Educating and empowering developers all over the world.
authors.title: Head of Developer Education

authors.bio: An English teacher turned empathetic software engineer. A curious optimist with a passion for creating accessible content and helping developers level up their skills.
authors.name: Lauren Lee
authors.title: Developer Education Manager

authors.bio: I'm a JavaScript developer and a Developer Educator at Vonage. Over the years I’ve been really excited about templates, Node.js, progressive web apps, and offline-first strategies, but what I’ve always really loved is a useful, well-documented API. My goal is to make your experience using our APIs the very best I can help it be.
authors.name: Garann Means
authors.title: Developer Educator

authors.name: Dotun Jolaoso
authors.bio: Software Developer who loves building awesome tools and products. I currently work with Laravel, PHP and Vue.

authors.name: Aaron Bassett
authors.bio: Aaron was a developer advocate at Nexmo. A seasoned software engineer and wannabe digital artist Aaron is frequently found creating things with code, or electronics; sometimes both. You can customarily tell when he's working on something new by the smell of burning components in the air.

authors.name: Abdul Ajetunmobi
authors.bio: Abdul is a Developer Advocate for Vonage. He has a background working in consumer products as an iOS Engineer. In his spare time, he enjoys biking, listening to music and mentoring those who are just beginning their journey in tech

authors.name: Adam Culp
authors.bio: Adam is a developer and consultant who enjoys ultra-running, blogging/vlogging, and helping others tame technology to accomplish amazing things with an insatiable desire to mentor and help.

authors.name: Adam DuVander
authors.bio: Adam DuVander loves APIs and the people behind them. He leads Zapier's developer marketing, connecting 2+ million people to more than 1,000 APIs. Previously he led developer communications at SendGrid and was the first editor of ProgrammableWeb, the journal of the API economy.

authors.name: Adam Ullman
authors.bio: Based in Australia, Adam and his team lead Client Platform Engineering for OpenTok Client SDKs, including iOS, Android, Windows, and web-based (Javascript) SDKs. From a very young age, Adam has always been passionate about technology. This early love continues to influence him, fueling his drive to build APIs and applications that are both elegant and easy-to-use.

authors.name: Adrian Francis
authors.bio: Adrian is a problem solver and Python developer advocate. He works with various programming languages to solve engineering problems. Introduced to programming at age 16, Adrian has spent the last 8 years oscillating between backend development and automation. He lives in Nairobi and when not writing code he is most likely playing Call Of Duty or NBA 2K on his PlayStation, riding his bicycle or binge watching the latest series on Netflix.

authors.name: Alex Lakatos
authors.bio: Alex Lakatos is a JavaScript Developer Advocate for Nexmo. In his spare time he volunteers at Mozilla as a Tech Speaker and a Reps Mentor. JavaScript developer building on the open web, he has been pushing its boundaries every day. You can check out his github profile or get in touch on twitter. When he’s not programming in London, he likes to travel the world, so it’s likely you’ll bump into him in an airport lounge.

authors.name: Alexandros Dimas
authors.bio: Alexandros is a Product Manager at Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform, responsible for the customer-facing Nexmo Dashboard and related services. In his free time, he enjoys the outdoors as well as traveling around the world.

authors.name: Alyssa Mazzina
authors.bio: Alyssa is a writer and editor specializing in technology and the software development space. She lives in central California with her husband, kids, and three rescue dogs.

authors.name: Amanda Folson
authors.bio: From humble beginnings as a PHP4 web developer in grade school, Amanda now works as a Developer Relations Manager at Nexmo where she gets to share her passion for technology and education with others. In addition to consuming APIs and IPAs, she currently serves as a co-host for the PHPTownHall Podcast and is involved in Open Sourcing Mental Illness. In her spare time you’ll find her in a hammock with a guitar.

authors.name: Andrea Chiarelli
authors.bio:
Andrea Chiarelli has over 20 years of experience as a software engineer and technical writer. Throughout his career, he has used various technologies for the projects he was involved in.
Currently, he is a software architect at the Italian office of Apparound and contributes to a few online magazines and blogs.

authors.name: Assaf Passal and Roy Ben Shushan
authors.bio:
Assaf is a developer that enjoys hiking, working with wood, raising his five children, use and develop technology to make communication between people better and safer.
Roy is a solution engineer for the Vonage APIs. He is passionate about improving customer experience and creating solutions that enhance our APIs.

authors.name: Avital Tzubeli
authors.bio: Avital Tzubeli is a Developer Advocate at Vonage, where she’ll be building the local Vonage community in Tel Aviv. She’s originally from Miami Beach, and first spoke Spanish and Hebrew, before learning all her English from Harry Potter books. She studied CS and wrote some Java in NYC, then moved to Tel Aviv in search of better weather… where she fortunately also discovered the world of Developer Relations. Avital considers herself a storyteller, and loves the challenge of turning technical content into magical fairytales.

authors.name: Badri Rajasekar
authors.bio: Badri Rajasekar is the SVP of Engineering at Vonage - Video Engineering. He leads the core engineering and operations teams and is responsible for end-to-end service delivery, including product development, quality engineering, and customer solutions. Stanford football fan and alumni, start-up aficionado, artist and photographer, Badri is excited about the pursuit of insights.

authors.name: Ben Greenberg
authors.bio: Ben is a second career developer who previously spent a decade in the fields of adult education, community organizing and non-profit management. He works as a developer advocate for Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform by day and experiments with open source projects at night. He writes regularly on the intersection of community development and tech. Originally from Southern California and a long time resident of New York City, Ben now resides near Tel Aviv, Israel.

authors.name: Benita Kenn
authors.bio: Benita Kenn is Customer Reference Marketing Manager at Nexmo, The Vonage API Platform. She has worked for companies such as Facebook, SanDisk, Vidyo, Cisco and Apple over the course of the past two decades.  Benita is a seasoned writer with a strong public relations background.  In her spare time, she is a performing musician and composer.

authors.name: Benjamin Aronov
authors.bio: Benjamin Aronov is an online community manager at Vonage based in Tel Aviv, Israel.

authors.name: Bethany Loft
authors.bio: Bethany is a Junior Developer Community Event Manager who has a background in running student hackathons. She's passionate about environmentalism and discovering new bookshops, her favourite genre to read is digital anthropology.

authors.name: Britt Barak
authors.bio: Britt Barak is a Product Manager at Nexmo, for Nexmo Conversation API and Client SDKs.

authors.name: Caleb Ikhuohon
authors.bio: Caleb is a software developer who loves learning, teaching, building, and collaborating on distributed software systems that provide amazing value to its users

authors.name: Chris Guzman
authors.bio: Chris is a Developer Advocate at Nexmo where he helps developers use their global communications platform. When he’s not at conferences you can find him roaming the world.

authors.name: Chris Tankersley
authors.bio: Chris is the Senior PHP Developer Advocate and Server SDK Initiative Lead.  He has been programming for more than 15 years across various languages and types of projects from client work all the way up to big-data, large scale systems. He lives in Ohio, spending his time with his family and playing video and TTRPG games.

authors.name: Clarisse Ng
authors.bio: Clarisse is a community manager who enjoys doing yoga, baking and creating activities to help others develop their products/solutions through the use of technology

authors.name: Corbin Crutchley
authors.bio: Corbin in a passionate developer, teacher, and retro game enthusiast. Driven to help others, they started a site called Unicorn Utterances to help engage the community and provide a place for learning CS topics.

authors.name: Cyprien Godard
authors.bio: Cyprien Godard has 20 years+ of experience in IT, software and internet, on payment, communication, healthcare medical imaging. He had Marketing and Sales roles at GE Healthcare, iPIN(intel), PlanView, Ni2, PayXX, Approach. Cyprien holds a Masters in Engineering from HEI in France and Masters of Science in Computer Science from Stanford University

authors.name: Daniela Facchinetti
authors.bio: Daniela has been working in content for the e-commerce industry since 2012 and has landed at Vonage as Developer Education Coordinator after completing a course of Front End Development.

authors.name: David Vigar
authors.bio: David joined Nexmo during its early days having been a customer in his previous role as Carrier Relations Manager for iBasis/KPN. David built the Carrier Team and the Carrier Network which we use today to provide the best-in-class service we pride ourselves on. During his time as Director of Carrier Relations, David was also responsible for wholesale sales, pricing, routing, carrier accounts payabale, two office moves and quite a bit in addition. David is a keen wine collector, plays the Flute and Piccolo with the Kew Wind Orchestra and lives in Berkhamsted, Hertfordshire with his wife and two boys.

authors.name: Derek Handova
authors.bio: Derek Handova is an enthusiastic white paper writer and brand journalist in the B2B and technology spaces. In the past, he has led content creation efforts at prominent companies such as Altera, Solectron Corporation, BearingPoint Inc. and other Silicon Valley icons. He currently works in content at Nexmo, the Vonage API platform.

authors.name: Dev Rel @ Nexmo
authors.bio: Our mission is to build a world-class open source documentation platform to help developers build connected products.

authors.name: Diana Rodriguez
authors.bio: 🐍 Pythonista | Python Developer Advocate @ Vonage. Full-time nerd. Humorous when serious and serious when humorous. 20 years of nerding between infrastructure, backend and automation. Lover of board games.

authors.name: Douglas Kendyson
authors.bio: Douglas is a full stack software engineer with a keen interest to marketing, customer growth and data analytics. When he’s not coding, he’s probably watching way too many TV shows.

authors.name: Enrico Portolan
authors.bio:
Enrico is passionate about cloud, startups and new technologies. Co-Founder of a WebRTC Startup in Italy. 
Now he works as a Solutions Engineer at Nexmo, helping the sales team with his technical expertise.

Out of work, he likes to travel and taste as many weird foods as possible.

authors.name: Enrico Portolan and Roy Ben Shushan
authors.bio:
Enrico is passionate about cloud, startups and new technologies. Co-Founder of a WebRTC Startup in Italy. Now he works as a Solutions Engineer at Vonage, helping the sales team with his technical expertise.
Roy is a solution engineer for the Vonage APIs. He is passionate about improving customer experience and creating solutions that enhance our APIs.

authors.name: Eric Giannini
authors.bio: Eric Giannini is the iOS developer advocate at Nexmo. He is really passionate about both Objective-C and Swift, especially the latter. Eric blogs often about this, that or the other iOS thing, hacking apps, building SDKs, or rapidly prototyping. He also meets with iOS developers or other strongly typed Swift types at conferences, Meetups, and other variadic functions.

authors.name: Fabian Rodriguez
authors.bio: Fabian is part of the Developer Experience Team at Nexmo. He is a passionate software engineer who loves open source, machine learning and coffee.  When he isn't working on making our docs better you can find him cycling, reading or rooting for the Club Nacional de Football.

authors.name: Francisco Kattan
authors.bio: Francisco Kattan is the Head of Platform Marketing at Nexmo, The Vonage API Platform. As a leader in Marketing, he has worked with high growth, innovative software companies to help them disrupt entrenched incumbents in traditional industries. Francisco holds MS degrees in Electrical Engineering and Engineering Management from Stanford University. In his free time, he enjoys sailing in San Francisco Bay and volunteers to introduce people of all economic backgrounds to the sport.

authors.name: Glen Kunene
authors.bio: Glen Kunene works with a team of talented storytellers to educate product managers and developers about the power of programmable communications to transform how brands interact with their customers. He has been a professional chronicler of technology and business in the Silicon Valley since the pre-iPhone era. When he's not enjoying time with his family, he is training for his next road race or making excuses to avoid it.

authors.name: Guillermo Quintero
authors.bio: Guillermo is responsible for bringing new and exiciting technologies to market. He's currently an expat living in London with his wife, daughter, and Australian cattledog.

authors.name: Hugh Hopkins
authors.bio: Messaging Product Manager

authors.name: Hui Jing Chen
authors.bio: Hui Jing is a Developer Advocate at Nexmo. She has an inordinate love of CSS and typography, and is generally passionate about all things web.

authors.name: Jack Mardack
authors.bio: Before Vonage, Jack helped launch and scale several Bay Area startups, including Eventbrite and Prezi. He's from Queens.

authors.name: James Hickey
authors.bio: James is a Microsoft MVP with a background in fintech & insurance industries building web and mobile applications. He's the author of Refactoring TypeScript and the creator of some open-source tools for .NET called Coravel. He lives in eastern Canada and is a 10-minute drive from the highest tides in the world!

authors.name: Javier Molina Sanz
authors.bio: Javier studied Industrial Engineering back in Madrid where he’s from. He is now one of our Tech Support Engineers, so if you get into trouble using our APIs he may be the one that gives you a hand. Out of work he loves playing football and travelling as much as he can.

authors.name: Javier Molina Sanz and Svetlana Nazarenko
authors.bio:
--- Javier studied Industrial Engineering back in Madrid where he’s from. He is now one of our Tech Support Engineers, so if you get into trouble using our APIs he may be the one that gives you a hand. Out of work he loves playing football and travelling as much as he can.

--- Svetlana is a Software Engineer at Vonage, where she focuses on developing tools for internal usage within the company.
Prior to that role, she was an SDK Support Engineer at Vonage for 2 years, focusing on specifically the Client SDK for JS, Android and iOS support.
She enjoys working with developers, learning new stuff and building useful tools. When she is not developing things, you can find her travelling, reading and running.

authors.name: Jose Antonio Olivera Ortega
authors.bio: Based in Madrid, Spain, Jose Antonio is a Sr. Software Engineer at Nexmo, contributing to the OpenTok Client SDKs and native codebase. He loves cross-platform and test-driven development, but hates pair programming. As an avid learner and programmer, Jose Antonio enjoys discovering more ways to create and innovate with technology, including mobile operating systems, WebRTC apps, Web APIs, IoT, and more.

authors.name: Karl Hughes
authors.bio: Karl is a writer, speaker, and technology team lead. He’s currently the Chief Technology Officer at The Graide Network and runs CFP Land in his spare time.

authors.name: Katie McLaughlin
authors.bio: `cat` Lady. Adorkable. Verifiable Cutie. She/Her

authors.name: Kelly J Andrews
authors.bio:
Kelly J Andrews is a developer advocate for Nexmo and has been tinkering with computers for over 30 years, using BASIC for the first time at the age of 5.

It wasn't until building his first webpage in 1997, and trying out JavaScript for the first time that he found a true calling. Kelly now fights for JavaScript, testable code, and fast delivery.

You can find him singing karaoke, performing magic, or cheering for the Cubs and Fighting Irish.

authors.name: Kevin Alwell
authors.bio: Kevin Alwell is a PreSales Engineer for Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform.

authors.name: Kevin Lewis
authors.bio: Kevin Lewis is a Developer Advocate for Vonage, where his role is to support the local tech community in London. He’s an experienced events organiser, boardgamer and dad to a cute little dog called Moo. He’s also the lead organizer for You Got This - a network of events on the core skills needed for a happy, healthy work life.

authors.name: Kyle Riordan
authors.bio: Kyle joined the Nexmo team to be the Product Marketing Manager for the Voice API and comes with a background focused on productizing APIs. In his spare time, Kyle enjoys analyzing the deep philosophical questions like “Does anyone ever read these writer bios and if not were they written?”

authors.name: Liam Hackett
authors.bio: Liam is a full-stack engineer who primarily focuses on PHP and Javascript. He loves to learn and tinker with new tools and technology.

authors.name: Lori Belton
authors.bio: Lori is a writer and content marketer. She lives in the Bay Area with her husband, kids, and two dogs.

authors.name: Manik Sachdeva
authors.bio: Manik is a Senior Software Engineer at Nexmo where he focuses on building OpenTok Client SDKs for iOS, Android, Web, and Windows. He enjoys working with developers and crafting APIs. When he's not building APIs or SDKs, you can find him speaking at conferences and meetups.

authors.name: Manik Sachdeva
authors.bio: Manik is an Engineering Manager at Vonage where he and his team focus on building Video Client SDKs for iOS, Android, Web, Windows, Linux, and Unity. He enjoys working with developers, WebRTC, and crafting APIs. When he's not building APIs or SDKs, you can find him speaking at conferences and meetups.

authors.name: Maria Carlina Hernández
authors.bio: Maria is a passionate maker currently working as IoT Developer focused on System Integration & Hardware Development. Also, she is an organizer of IoT Medellin - a tech community that brings together IoT enthusiasts to share knowledge in LATAM.

authors.name: Mariatta
authors.bio: ??? Femail core developer • ??⛏️? • ??? • ??? • I am not open, parts of me are broken

authors.name: Mark Lewin
authors.bio: Technical writer at Nexmo. Loves playing with and documenting APIs.

authors.name: Mark Smith
authors.bio: Mark was nominally responsible for Nexmo's client libraries (although he only writes the Python and Java libraries). He was originally a Java developer, has been a Python developer for 18 years, and is increasingly dabbling with Go and Rust. He likes pushing programming languages to the limit and then teaching these techniques to other programmers. He has a Viking hat, but he isn't a Viking, and he's Judy2k on Twitter for reasons he won't discuss.

authors.name: Mark Summerson
authors.bio: Mark’s responsible for the Partner Ecosystem at Nexmo and a good day for him is when partners get together to create stuff that he couldn’t have imagined in the first place.

authors.name: Michael Heap
authors.bio: Michael is a polyglot software engineer, committed to reducing complexity in systems and making them more predictable. Working with a variety of languages and tools, he shares his technical expertise to audiences all around the world at user groups and conferences. Day to day, Michael is a developer advocate at Nexmo, where he spends his time learning, teaching and writing about all kinds of technology.

authors.name: Michael Jolley
authors.bio: Michael is the bald, bearded builder. Using his 20 years experience in software development and DevOps, this follicly challenged developer spends his days focused on helping others succeed.

authors.name: Michal Raz
authors.bio: Michal is the Vice President of Strategic Global Partnerships for Nexmo, The Vonage API Platform.

authors.name: Misha Behei
authors.bio: Misha is a Developer Support Engineer at Vonage where he works with the customers utilizing the Video API platform. In his free time, Misha enjoys exploring new coffee shops around San Francisco Bay Area as well as puts some time into learning new frameworks and languages.

authors.name: Myrsini Koukiasa
authors.bio: Myrsini is a Senior Community Programs Manager at Vonage. She helps the Developer Relations team support, engage and connect with developer communities where they are.

authors.name: Naomi Pentrel
authors.bio: Naomi Pentrel is a Software Engineer with a passion for organizing and attending hackathons. She has worked at companies such as Google, Microsoft, and Palantir. In her free time, she occasionally blogs about her side projects.

authors.name: Neena Thomas
authors.bio: Neena Thomas is the Head of Product Management, leading the Developer Experience and Ecosystem for the industry-leading OpenTok live video API at Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform. Based in the California Bay Area, Neena is passionate about exploring new technologies and markets.

authors.name: Nick Iati
authors.bio: Nick Iati is a technical writer at Vonage based in Rochester, New York.

authors.name: Oleksandr Bodriagov
authors.bio: Oleksandr Bodriagov is a Product Manager focused on security at Nexmo, The Vonage API Platform.

authors.name: Oliver Schlieben
authors.bio: Oliver Schlieben is Senior Director of Product Management for the Communications Portfolio at Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform.

authors.name: Omar Javaid
authors.bio: Omar Javaid is Chief Product Officer and President of the API Platform Group at Vonage.

authors.name: Oscar Rodriguez
authors.bio: Oscar Rodriguez is the Director Global Solution Engineering at Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform

authors.name: Parth Awasthi
authors.bio: A passionate technologist with a background in web and mobile products, Parth joined the Nexmo product team in 2014. At Nexmo, Parth shipped the first few value-added service APIs at Nexmo such as Number Insight and Verify and is now responsible for the Messaging API portfolio for Vonage. He obsesses over creating a platform which enables Business Messaging experiences that put customers first. Outside of work, Parth is an avid cyclist, photographer, theatre enthusiast, and loves to read autobiographies and literary fiction. Parth has a bachelors in Information and Communication Technology, and an MBA with a dual major in Finance and Strategy & Leadership.

authors.name: Paul Ardeleanu
authors.bio: Paul is an iOS Developer Advocate at Nexmo. A seasoned software engineer, trainer and speaker, he specialised in data-driven solutions on Apple platforms with an emphasis on prototyping, best practices and balance with agility.

authors.name: Phil Leggetter
authors.bio:
Phil is Head of Developer Relations at Nexmo. He's been working with real-time technologies since 2001 and has a background in building real-time SDKs and web browser-based trading apps. He spends most of his time working on developer relations and community at Nexmo and sharing those experiences. He also continues to share ideas of how real-time technologies can be used to enhance the features and performance of apps, and the experiences that they deliver to users.

Phil's interests include developer community, JavaScript, architecture, real-time communications, APIs, developer tools and workflows, and developer experience.

authors.name: Rabeb Othmani
authors.bio: Rabeb was a Developer Advocate at Nexmo focusing on cloud communication APIs and helping developers get the best experience possible when building their apps. Other than writing code for a living, Rabeb advocates for bringing more women and minorities into tech, thus her involvement with Women Who Code and different tech communities. She leads the Women Who Code Network in Bristol.

authors.name: Richard Fox
authors.bio: Richard Fox has 8 years experience in supporting the customer communication and verification needs of the leading global web properties and digital native organisations across EMEA. Using cloud-based APIs to deliver better business outcomes, have partnered with hundreds of SMB's and Enterprises across Travel, Financial Services, iGaming, eCommerce and SAAS verticals to build more intuitive and efficient communication experiences with end users.

authors.name: Roberto Perez Cubero
authors.bio: Roberto is a Full Stack Engineer on the OpenTok Client SDK team. He loves learning new bits of Android, iOS, Linux, Windows, you name it! In his free time, he is very passionate about programming languages, computer graphics, and video game development for current and old platforms like ZX Spectrum and Commodore 64.

authors.name: Roland Selmer
authors.bio: Roland Selmer is VP of Product Management for the API Platform Group at Vonage. He leads product management for Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform. He has vast experience around building products for various startups and telcos, mainly in the communications space.

authors.name: Roy Ben Shushan and Frans Siswanto
Russ Williams
authors.bio: Russ has been arguing with computers since 1985, and now mostly wins the fights. He has worked in video games, defence and investment banking, and joined the Vonage team four days before the Coronavirus lockdown. He enjoys travel, poker, games of all sorts, science fiction, and is easily dist... ooh, squirrel!

authors.name: Sam Machin
authors.bio: Sam Machin has nearly 20 years of experience in the communications industry and a strong track record of innovation. His role as a developer advocate  enables him to attend events where he loves to chat with developers about their projects, His personal projects mostly revolve around Amazon Alexa, Sam created the AlexaPi project allowing developers to build thier own Alexa powered devices and he is recognised by Amazon as an Alexa Champion.

authors.name: Sheri Atienza
authors.bio: Sheri Atienza is the Director of Marketing for Nexmo, the Vonage API Platform.

authors.name: Shyam Purkayastha
authors.bio: Shyam is the Founder of Radiostud.io, a content-lead innovation studio, focusing on showcasing use cases of emerging technologies. He  is an entrepreneur, a technology evangelist, author, and mentor with a deep passion for nurturing ideas and building things around emerging and futuristic trends in Computing, Information Technology, and Telecommunications.

authors.name: Solomon Soh
authors.bio: Solomon Soh is a Alteryx and Alibaba Cloud Certified practitioner who focus on developing AI solutions for ad-tech, fintech, and operational business problems.

authors.name: Steve Crow
authors.bio: Steve is a self-proclaimed Mathlete, and King of Snark. He is also a lover of Greyhounds, twisty puzzles, and European Board Games.  When not talking math to non-math people, and Java to non-Java people, he can be found sipping coffee and hacking on code.

authors.name: Steve Lorello
authors.bio: .NET Developer Advocate @Nexmo, full-stack polyglottic Software Engineer, AI/ML Grad Student, avid runner, and an even more avid traveler.

authors.name: Sumit Suman
authors.bio: Sumit Suman is a product lead at Nexmo and heads up the Chat App API product. Chat App API is his baby -- he has been on the team since fall of 2014 when Nexmo first decided to build the API. Sumit has also launched multiple messaging and collaboration products, including a company of his own. He is a computer science engineer and an MBA (which he hides under the carpet since moving to San Francisco).

authors.name: Tamir Tuch
authors.bio: iOS Developer @Vonage, with a large interest in software development, hiking, machine learning, and fighting Muay Thai. In love with solving problems, everything in between solving a differential equation to defeating an opponent in a fight.

authors.name: Taylor Otwell
authors.bio: Husband to @abigailotwell. Web Developer. Founder of Laravel, Forge, Envoyer, Spark, and more.

authors.name: Tom Morris
authors.bio: Polyglot hacker and lifelong student trying a little bit of everything and documenting the experience.

authors.name: Tomomi Imura
authors.bio: Open web & technology ? HTML5, JavaScript, Node.js. Cat hacks ?, and Internet of Blings ✨ (that slightly more than LED blinks ?). Developer Advocate at Nexmo San Francisco.

authors.name: Tony Bedford
authors.bio: Experienced technical writer who loves nothing more than writing docs and code.

authors.name: Tony Hung
authors.bio: IOS Developer turned Data Science / Machine Learning enthusiast. I want people to understand what machine learning is and how we can use it in our applications.

authors.name: Tony Jamous
authors.bio: Tony Jamous has over 14 years of leadership experience in cloud, communication, and mobile industries. At mBlox and Boku, Tony opened up global messaging and payment services. Tony holds a Masters in Computer Science from Grenoble Institute of Technology in France and an MBA from the International Institute for Management Development in Switzerland, with a focus on leadership development and organization behavior.

authors.name: Vanessa Perez
authors.bio: Vanessa Perez is a Carrier Operations Manager at Nexmo, The Vonage API Platform. She manages relationships with and provisioning activities for SMS vendors in the US and Canada. In her free time, she enjoys the outdoors and rooting for her favorite bay area sports teams.

authors.name: Victor Shisterov
authors.bio: Victor is a product manager for Vonage Voice API with seven years of experience in the telecom industry, and a software developer since his childhood. He is passionate about making technically complex things easy to understand and to use, by keeping powerful API self-descriptive and consistent. When not inventing and coding, he builds scale models and plays folk musical instruments.

authors.name: Victor Steven
authors.bio: Victor Steven is a self-taught full-stack developer that loves researching about doing things differently. He has a degree in Engineering and over 5 years of experience as a software developer. Steven is very interested in designing and building scalable APIs and he enjoys writing about his discoveries in software development.

authors.name: Yonatan Mevorach
authors.bio: Yonatan Mevorach is a Web Developer, blogger, and open-source contributor.

authors.name: Yuriy Dybskiy
authors.bio: Yuriy is a Developer Advocate at Nexmo working on integrations with other excellent cloud providers such as Google, Microsoft and IBM. He lives in San Francisco and has previously worked on code and advocacy for Meteor, Lyft, Unbounce, Cloudant and many others.

authors.name: Zining Wang
authors.bio: Zining is a Product Manager at Vonage focused on developer tooling. With a background in engineering, he is passionate about building products that make life easier, especially ones that help people better connect with one another. Outside of work you can find him tinkering with ARKit or playing guitar.
